CatDescriptText: Vera Faulkner, 2115 Rose Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 25, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think there would be less juvenile delinquency if the father were restored to his original role as sole head of the house?" answer reads: "No, because I think that it's a partnership. The father should not have full responsibility.  Action by both would result in better children than if it were a one sided affair by the father."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Vera Faulkner wearing felted button down coat, eyeglasses, and floral scarf, holding a paper shopping bag and handbag, standing on sidewalk in front of store window with kitchen appliances
